fc

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • fc.Node

  • public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    A node is a word in the sentence tree. It can have multiple sons (the possible words that can follow in a sentence)
    Author:
    Laurent Fite

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean endsPattern
      Can the node conclude a sentence?
      boolean optional
      Is the node not necessary in the sentence?

    • Method Detail

      • hasSon

        public boolean hasSon(java.lang.String c)
        Checks if the Node has the son with the same value as the String given as parameter
        Parameters:
        c - The value of the son you want to check the existence of
        Returns:
        True if a son has c for value

      • hasSon

        public boolean hasSon(Node n)
        Checks if the Node has the son with the same value as the one given as parameter
        Parameters:
        n - Node that will be compared to all the sons
        Returns:
        True if a son has the same value as n

        Parameters:
        c - Value of the son
        Returns:
        True if there is only one son with the value given as parameter

        Check if there is only one son equals to n
        Parameters:
        n - Node whose value will be compared to..
        Returns:

      • addSentence

        public void addSentence(java.lang.String s)
        Add a sentence to the tree.
        Parameters:
        s - The sentence to be added. It will be split with " " and each word will be added one after the other

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Node n,
             boolean bypass)
        Check if the Node is equal to the one given as parameter. This checks if the subtrees are the same and if the value is the same. (the last step can be bypassed)
        Parameters:
        n - Node to compare
        bypass - If true, the function won't check if the value is the same
        Returns:
        True if the Nodes are equal

      • simplify

        public Node simplify()
        Clones the tree and simplifies it.
        Returns:
        A new simplified tree

      • getPossibleSentences

        public java.lang.String getPossibleSentences(java.lang.String p,
                                    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> solutions)
        From this node, get all the possible paths to leaves
        Parameters:
        p - Inherited value
        solutions - ArrayList in which all the different paths will be written
        Returns:
        Nothing interesting to the principal caller, but is useful for recursive purposes.

      • getSons

        public java.util.ArrayList<Node> getSons()
        Get sons of this Node
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Nodes (the sons)
